itemDescription: Welsh wife of Methodist Charles Wesley

wikipedia_page.main: Sarah Wesley, née Gwynne, also known as Sally Wesley  (1726 – 28 December 1822) was the wife of itinerant Methodist Charles Wesley, brother of John Wesley, the main founder of Methodism. The daughter of a wealthy family, Wesley once performed musically for George III and passed this talent onto two of her sons, both of whom were musical prodigies.
